title: A R Package for Implementing Resampling-based Structure Learning for Markov and conditional Gaussian Bayesian Networks
text: Using devtools package

title: A R Package for Implementing Resampling-based Structure Learning for Markov and conditional Gaussian Bayesian Networks
text: Conditional Gaussian Bayesian Network (CGBN) functionalities ensemble_cgbn consensus_net_cgbn optional require RHugin package. Installation instructions macOS, windows, Linux.

title: A R Package for Implementing Resampling-based Structure Learning for Markov and conditional Gaussian Bayesian Networks
Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
text: Computes two-sided p-value confidence interval statistic mi null distribution pi. Internally uses bias-corrected mapping null via \(z_0\) finds calibration \(z_A\) minimizing CI width criterion (Brent's method).

title: Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
text: mi Numeric scalar. observed measure/statistic. pi Numeric vector. null/sampling distribution (e.g., permutation bootstrap). NAs removed. conf Numeric (0,1). Confidence level interval. Default 0.95.

title: Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
text: one-row data.frame columns: test_dir: "" mi > 0 else "" z: signed z-score aligned mi pval: two-sided p-value fdr: Benjamini–Hochberg adjusted p-value (computed returned row) ci_low, ci_high: confidence interval bounds level conf

title: Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
text: Let \(\hat{F}\) empirical CDF pi. Define $$ z_0 = \mathrm{sign}(-\mathbb{E}[pi - mi]) \cdot \left| \Phi^{-1}\{\hat{F}(mi)\} \right|, $$ find \(z_A\) minimizes CI width induced transformed quantiles \(\Phi(2 z_0 \pm z_A)\). two-sided p-value \(2 \Phi(-|z_A|)\) (conf)-level CI uses \(z_\alpha = \Phi^{-1}(\alpha)\) \(\alpha = (1 - \mathrm{conf})/2\).

title: Differential connectivity bootstrap statistics (bias-corrected) — bootBCStats
code: set.seed(1) mi <- 0.15 pi <- rnorm(1000, mean = 0, sd = 0.2) bootBCStats(mi, pi) #>   test_dir        z      pval      ci_low   ci_high       fdr #> 1       Up 1.464833 0.1429665 -0.08602647 0.7229401 0.1429665

what: Differential connectivity nulls via permutation/bootstrap + GGM — null_ggm
title: Differential connectivity nulls via permutation/bootstrap + GGM — null_ggm
text: Generates collection null networks repeatedly shuffling data (via permutation bootstrap) fitting sparse Gaussian graphical model (SILGGM) within label-defined group. iteration returns named list two igraph objects (one per group). Edge attributes include: qval — BH-adjusted p-values pval — p-values precision-matrix inference pcor — partial correlations sign — sign partial correlation (+1 / -1)

title: Differential connectivity nulls via permutation/bootstrap + GGM — null_ggm
code: null_ggm(   dat,   inference_method = c("D-S_NW_SL", "B_NW_SL"),   shuffle_method = c("permutation", "bootstrap"),   shuffle_iter = 100,   group_col = "phenotype",   balanced = FALSE,   filter = c("pval", "fdr", "none"),   threshold = 0.05,   n_cores = NULL,   seed = NULL )

title: Differential connectivity nulls via permutation/bootstrap + GGM — null_ggm
text: dat data.frame; p numeric feature columns + one label column. inference_method one c("D-S_NW_SL", "B_NW_SL"). shuffle_method character; one c("permutation","bootstrap"). shuffle_iter integer; number null resamples (default 100). group_col character; name label column (default "phenotype"). balanced logical; used shuffle_method = "permutation". TRUE, downsample equal group sizes permutation. filter character; one c("pval","fdr","none"). threshold numeric; threshold edge inclusion filter != "none". n_cores integer; number cores parallel computing seed integer; random seet

title: Differential connectivity nulls via permutation/bootstrap + GGM — null_ggm
text: list length shuffle_iter; element named list   (group labels) igraph objects
